definition: to break out of prison/to jailbreak (an iOS device etc)
generic word for peoples or states of south China or south Asia at different historical periods/abbr. for Vietnam 越南
to exceed/to climb over/to surpass/the more... the more
prison
escaped prisoner

sentences.english: Local officials said the escape as "the devil" to help.
sentences.chinese: 當地官員稱，越獄有“內鬼”幫助。

sentences.english: With a period of only thee weeks, five prisoners succeeded in escaping from the prison.
sentences.chinese: 那囚犯費盡心機找一個越獄的辦法，他終於成功了。

sentences.english: Abruzzi is a necessary player in the escape.
sentences.chinese: Abruzzi在越獄過程中是必不可少的棋子。

sentences.english: This prison break-out started with a break-in.
The escaped prisoner is still at large.
The escapees – hidden behind various shelves – look on with concern.
sentences.chinese: 越獄犯一夥藏身在架子後面，關切地注意情況的變化。

sentences.english: The country has seen several jailbreaks this year in which inmates have been killed.
sentences.chinese: 今年泰國發生了幾次越獄，造成了數名犯人的傷亡。

sentences.english: He called the prison break a disaster.
sentences.chinese: 他把這次越獄事件看做一場災難。

sentences.english: In northern Henan Province Prison 25 occurred in the early morning escape together.
sentences.chinese: 河南省豫北監獄25日凌晨發生一起越獄事件。

sentences.english: Hermione, there's obviously been a mass breakout which the Ministry has hushed up.
sentences.chinese: 赫敏，顯然發生了集體越獄，魔法部封鎖了消息。

sentences.english: A new message appears on the screen saying your jailbreak is ready.
sentences.chinese: 屏幕上出現一條新的信息，顯示越獄已經完成。

sentences.english: The notorious drug - pusher has been contriving an escape from the prison.
sentences.chinese: 臭名昭著的大毒梟一直都在圖謀越獄。

sentences.english: The crime of escaping from prison by a riot appears in China's Criminal Law for the first time.
sentences.chinese: 暴動越獄罪出現於我國刑法典尚屬首次。

sentences.english: A jailbreak lets your device be how you want it.
sentences.chinese: 越獄使設備成爲你想要的樣子。

sentences.english: He then goes on to chat about a Prison Break spinoff.
sentences.chinese: 接着他就聊到了《越獄》衍生劇的事兒。

sentences.english: He spent two months in prison before he broke out.
sentences.chinese: 他越獄逃走之前在獄中坐牢兩個月。

definition: prison
to kidnap/to abduct/to hijack/a kidnapping/abduction/staking
move (in chess, on stage, in martial arts)/gambit/trick/scheme/movement/same as 著數|着数[zhao1 shu4]
to hide (as an undercover agent)/an insider (in a gang of thieves)/a mole
story line/plot
to rob a tomb
to open fire/to shoot a gun
to execute by firing squad/to shoot dead/fig. to discard/to get rid of
homicide/to murder/to kill (a person)
at the minimum/at the very least
to castrate/fig. to emasculate
conclusion/ending
to order the arrest of sb as criminal/to list as wanted
to abridge (a text)/to edit out (of a movie)/to cut back (a budget, a curriculum)
to take sth for granted
taken in (by sb's deceit)/to be fooled/to be duped
